message: I hate when i comment code on my html files with some PHP or Javascript in it and it does whatever it wants. Do you guys have any "smart" commenter plugin for vim?
I use NERDCommenter http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=1218
I'll second NERDCommenter. Works great.
BTW quick tip: `\cc` to comment line (or selected) and `\cu` to uncomment.
I map mine to `,c<Space>`, works pretty nice
I also use NERDCommenter. Works amazingly well.
I also use NERDCommenter (after trying a few). It has a few minor annoyances, but it works pretty well.
I map toggle comment to "alt-/", since most other editors/IDEs map it to "ctrl-/" but that's not valid in vim.
Alternative to NERDCommenter is tComment, which I use: http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=1173
What EnhCommentify.vim? http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=23 Anybody has any exp using it?
@OryBand I used that one before I discovered NERD. It was really good, I just thought NERD was better.
I'm also using tComment. Just type gcc to toggle comments. Here is the github repo for pathogen users: https://github.com/tomtom/tcomment_vim.

I’m trying out NERDCommenter but can’t figure out if it’s capable of recognising embedded file types such as an html snippet inside a php file. I’ve tried setting filetype to php.html but to no avail. I understand tcomment can do this.
for some reason my binding is set to \c<space> for the toogle.. how can i change that?

@aseba If it's just that you don't like the \ in front, that's just what your <leader> is mapped to. You can change that with something like the following in your .vimrc:

" sets leader to ',' and localleader to "\"
let mapleader=","
let maplocalleader="\\"

@aseba You can learn more about your general options with NERD Commenter by typing

:h Commenter
